page.title: 01Church Lench.
page.content: This area includes the village of Church Lench and several small hamlets.The population has increased by 50% in the thirty years to 1981.In 1951 it was 410,and in 1981 it was 650.Housing has also doubled in the same period ; from 129 to 240.The largest increase was in the 10 years between 1961 and 1971. The parish church of ALL SAINTS has Norman features,but a Saxon church was recorded on this site in 1054 A.D. (Chirichlench).There is a village hall, a school and "The Lenches Club" but no public houses. The village hall is run by a committee.It is used on a variety of occasions for events which include church activities,keep-fit classes, clubs and social gatherings. This is an agricultural area with no industrial development whatsoever.
